initialization.python:
from rulebricks import Rulebricks

client = Rulebricks(
    api_key="YOUR_API_KEY",
)
initialization.go:
import (
    sdk "github.com/rulebricks/go-sdk"
    "github.com/rulebricks/go-sdk/client"
    "github.com/rulebricks/go-sdk/option"
)

opts := option.WithAPIKey("YOUR_API_KEY")
client := client.NewClient(opts)
initialization.csharp:
using RulebricksApi;

var client = new RulebricksApiClient("YOUR_API_KEY");

resources.name: Rules
resources.description: Operations for efficiently executing individual rules in different formats

methods.name: solve
methods.description: Executes a single rule identified by a unique slug. The request and response formats are dynamic, dependent on the rule configuration.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the rule.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Dynamic request payload based on the rule's request schema.

returns.description: Rule execution result. The response structure depends on the rule configuration.

exampleOutput.message: User is eligible for the promotion.

methods.name: bulkSolve
methods.description: Executes a particular rule against multiple request data payloads provided in a list.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the rule.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Array of request payloads (max 1000).

returns.description: Array of results, each dependent on the rule configuration.

exampleOutput.message: User is eligible for the promotion.
User is not eligible for the promotion.

methods.name: parallelSolve
methods.description: Executes multiple rules or flows in parallel based on a provided mapping of rule/flow slugs to payloads.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Object mapping keys to rule/flow payloads. Use $rule or $flow to specify the target.

returns.description: Object mirroring the request structure, providing each rule/flow's results.

eligibility.message: User is eligible for the product.

resources.name: Flows
resources.description: Operations for executing flows, which are sequences of rules and external actions

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Execute a flow by its slug.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the flow.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Dynamic request payload matching the flow's origin rule schema.

exampleOutput.message: User is eligible for the promotion.

resources.name: Decisions
resources.description: Query highly detailed logs of prior rule executions within the last 90 days

methods.name: query
methods.description: Query decision logs with support for the decision data query language, rule/status filters, date ranges, and pagination.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Decision data query language expression (e.g., status=200, score>10).

parameters.name: rules
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of rule names to filter by.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of HTTP status codes to filter by.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start date for the query range (ISO8601).

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date for the query range (ISO8601).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page (default: 100).

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: If 'true', returns only the count of matching logs.

examples.python:
client.decisions.query(
    search="status=200",
    rules="Lead Qualification,Pricing Calculator",
    statuses="200,400,500",
)

resources.name: Values
resources.description: Operations for managing dynamic values referenced in rules

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieve all dynamic values for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Query values containing a specific name.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Use 'usage' to include which rules reference each value.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update existing dynamic values or add new ones. Supports nested objects which are automatically flattened using dot notation.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Dictionary of keys and values to update or add.

parameters.name: user_groups
parameters.description: Optional array of user group names or IDs.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific dynamic value by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the dynamic value to delete.

resources.name: Users
resources.description: Operations for managing users on your team and their permissions

methods.name: invite
methods.description: Invite a new user to the organization or update role/user group data for an existing user.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email of the user to invite.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Role to assign ('admin', 'editor', 'developer', or custom role ID).

parameters.name: user_groups
parameters.description: List of user group names or IDs to assign.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all users in the organization with their details.

examples.csharp: await client.Users.ListAsync();

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new user directly with a password, bypassing the email invitation flow.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address for the new user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password for the new user (minimum 8 characters).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Display name for the user.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Role to assign (defaults to 'developer').

parameters.name: user_groups
parameters.description: List of user group names or IDs.

subResources.name: groups
subResources.description: Manage user groups in your organization

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all user groups available in your organization.

examples.csharp: await client.Users.Groups.ListAsync();

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new user group in your organization.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Unique name of the user group.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the user group.

examples.python:
client.users.groups.create(
    name="NewGroup",
    description="Description of the new group.",
)
examples.ruby:
client.users.groups.create(
  name: 'NewGroup',
  description: 'Description of the new group.'
)

resources.name: Assets
resources.description: Administrative operations for managing rules, flows, folders, and usage

methods.name: getUsage
methods.description: Get the rule execution usage of your organization.

examples.csharp: await client.Assets.GetUsageAsync();

methods.name: importRbm
methods.description: Import rules, flows, contexts, and values from a Rulebricks manifest file (*.rbm).

parameters.name: manifest
parameters.description: The RBM manifest object containing assets to import.

parameters.name: conflict_strategy
parameters.description: How to handle conflicts: 'update' overwrites, 'skip' ignores, 'error' fails.

parameters.name: target_folder_name
parameters.description: Optional folder name to place imported assets into.

examples.python:
from rulebricks.assets import ImportManifestRequestManifest

client.assets.import_rbm(
    manifest=ImportManifestRequestManifest(
        version="1.0",
        rules=[{"name": "Pricing Rule", "slug": "pricing-rule"}],
        flows=[{"name": "Onboarding Flow", "slug": "onboarding-flow"}],
        entities=[{"name": "Customer", "slug": "customer"}],
        values=[{"name": "tax_rate", "value": 0.08}],
    ),
    conflict_strategy="update",
)

methods.name: exportRbm
methods.description: Export selected rules, flows, contexts, and values to a Rulebricks manifest file (*.rbm).

parameters.name: root_type
parameters.description: The type of root asset to export ('rule', 'flow', or 'context').

parameters.name: root_ids
parameters.description: Array of IDs/slugs for the root assets to export.

parameters.name: include_downstream
parameters.description: For context exports, whether to include bound rules and flows.

parameters.name: preview_only
parameters.description: If true, returns a preview without full data.

returns.description: The exported manifest containing all assets and dependencies.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all rules in the organization. Optionally filter by folder.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Filter rules by folder name or folder ID.

exampleOutput.name: Pricing Calculator
exampleOutput.description: Calculates product pricing based on inputs

methods.name: pull
methods.description: Export a specific rule by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the rule to export.

methods.name: push
methods.description: Import a rule into the user's account.

parameters.name: rule
parameters.description: The rule data to import.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific rule by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the rule to delete.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all flows in the organization.

examples.csharp: await client.Assets.Flows.ListAsync();

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieve all rule folders.

examples.csharp: await client.Assets.Folders.ListAsync();

methods.name: upsert
methods.description: Create a new folder or update an existing one.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the folder.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the folder.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of existing folder to update.

examples.python:
client.assets.folders.upsert(
    name="Marketing Rules",
    description="Rules for marketing automation workflows",
)
examples.ruby:
client.assets.folders.upsert(
  name: 'Marketing Rules',
  description: 'Rules for marketing automation workflows'
)

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific folder. Does not delete rules within the folder.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the folder to delete.

resources.name: Contexts
resources.description: Operations for managing and interacting with live Context instances

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieve the current state of a context instance.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

returns.description: Current state of the context instance.

methods.name: submit
methods.description: Submit data to a context instance, creating it if it doesn't exist. May trigger bound rule/flow evaluations.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Data to submit to the instance.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific context instance and its history.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

methods.name: getHistory
methods.description: Retrieve the change history for a context instance.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Filter history to a specific field.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of history entries to return.

methods.name: getPending
methods.description: Get list of rules/flows that need to be evaluated for this instance.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

methods.name: solve
methods.description: Execute a specific rule using the context instance's state as input.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

parameters.name: rule_slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the rule.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Additional data to merge with context state.

exampleOutput.message: Customer is eligible for premium tier.

methods.name: cascade
methods.description: Trigger re-evaluation of all bound rules and flows for the instance.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Additional options for cascade.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Execute a specific flow using the context instance's state as input.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the context.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context instance.

parameters.name: flow_slug
parameters.description: The unique slug for the flow.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Additional data to merge with context state.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieve all context schemas.

examples.csharp: await client.Contexts.Objects.ListAsync();

exampleOutput.name: Customer
exampleOutput.description: Represents a customer in the system

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieve a specific context schema by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the context.

exampleOutput.name: Customer
exampleOutput.description: Represents a customer in the system

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update an existing context's properties and schema.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the context.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the context.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the context.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Updated schema fields for the context.

examples.python:
client.contexts.objects.update(
    id="a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890",
    name="Updated Customer",
    description="Updated description for premium customers",
)
examples.ruby:
client.contexts.objects.update(
  id: 'a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890',
  name: 'Updated Customer',
  description: 'Updated description for premium customers'
)

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new context schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the context.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the context.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Array of schema field definitions.

parameters.name: identity_fact
parameters.description: Field to use as the identity fact.

examples.ruby:
client.contexts.objects.create(
  name: 'Customer',
  description: 'Represents a customer in the system'
)

exampleOutput.name: Customer
exampleOutput.description: Represents a customer in the system

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a context schema and all its instances.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the context to delete.

methods.name: list
methods.description: List all relationships for a specific context.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the context.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new relationship between two contexts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the source context.

parameters.name: to_context_id
parameters.description: The ID of the target context.

parameters.name: relation_type
parameters.description: Type of relationship ('has_one' or 'has_many').

parameters.name: foreign_key_fact
parameters.description: The foreign key field.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name for the relationship.

examples.typescript:
await client.contexts.relationships.create({
    id: "a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890",
    toContextId: "b2c3d4e5-f6a7-8901-bcde-f12345678901",
    relationType: "has_many",
    foreignKeyFact: "customer_id",
    name: "Customer Orders"
})
examples.go:
request := &contexts.CreateContextRelationshipsRequest{
    Id: "a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890",
    ToContextId: "b2c3d4e5-f6a7-8901-bcde-f12345678901",
    RelationType: contexts.CreateRelationshipRequestRelationTypeHasMany,
    ForeignKeyFact: "customer_id",
}
client.Contexts.Relationships.Create(context.TODO(), request)

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete a specific relationship between contexts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the source context.

parameters.name: relationship
parameters.description: The ID of the relationship to delete.

resources.name: Tests
resources.description: Administrative operations for programmatically managing test suites for rules and flows

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieves a list of tests associated with a rule.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the rule.

returns.description: List of tests for the rule.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a new test to the test suite of a rule.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the rule.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the test.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request object for the test.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The expected response object for the test.

parameters.name: critical
parameters.description: Indicates whether the test is critical.

examples.python:
client.tests.rules.create(
    slug="slug",
    name="Test 3",
    request={"param1": "value1"},
    response={"status": "success"},
    critical=True,
)
examples.typescript:
await client.tests.rules.create({
    slug: "slug",
    name: "Test 3",
    request: { param1: "value1" },
    response: { status: "success" },
    critical: true
})
examples.go:
request := &tests.CreateRulesTestsRequest{
    Slug: "slug",
    Name: "Test 3",
    Request: map[string]any{"param1": "value1"},
    Response: map[string]any{"status": "success"},
    Critical: true,
}
client.Tests.Rules.Create(context.TODO(), request)
examples.ruby:
client.tests.rules.create(
  slug: 'slug',
  name: 'Test 3',
  request: { param1: 'value1' },
  response: { status: 'success' },
  critical: true
)

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a test from the test suite of a rule.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the rule.

parameters.name: test_id
parameters.description: The ID of the test to delete.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Retrieves a list of tests associated with a flow.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the flow.

returns.description: List of tests for the flow.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Adds a new test to the test suite of a flow.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the flow.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the test.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request object for the test.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The expected response object for the test.

parameters.name: critical
parameters.description: Indicates whether the test is critical.

examples.python:
client.tests.flows.create(
    slug="slug",
    name="Test 3",
    request={"param1": "value1"},
    response={"status": "success"},
    critical=True,
)
examples.typescript:
await client.tests.flows.create({
    slug: "slug",
    name: "Test 3",
    request: { param1: "value1" },
    response: { status: "success" },
    critical: true
})
examples.go:
request := &tests.CreateFlowsTestsRequest{
    Slug: "slug",
    Name: "Test 3",
    Request: map[string]any{"param1": "value1"},
    Response: map[string]any{"status": "success"},
    Critical: true,
}
client.Tests.Flows.Create(context.TODO(), request)
examples.ruby:
client.tests.flows.create(
  slug: 'slug',
  name: 'Test 3',
  request: { param1: 'value1' },
  response: { status: 'success' },
  critical: true
)

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a test from the test suite of a flow.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The unique identifier (slug) for the flow.

parameters.name: test_id
parameters.description: The ID of the test to delete.

resources.name: Forge
resources.description: Programmatically build and manage rules in memory. Available in Python and TypeScript SDKs only.

subResources.name: Rule
subResources.description: Create and configure business rules with request/response schemas and conditions

methods.name: constructor
methods.description: Create a new Rule instance. Optionally pass a Rulebricks client to enable workspace operations.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Optional Rulebricks client for workspace operations.

examples.python:
from rulebricks.forge import Rule

# Create a standalone rule
rule = Rule()

# Or with a workspace client
from rulebricks import Rulebricks
client = Rulebricks(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
rule = Rule(client)

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set the rule's display name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name for the rule.

returns.description: The rule instance for method chaining.

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Set the rule's description.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description for the rule.

returns.description: The rule instance for method chaining.

examples.python: rule.set_description("Calculates product pricing based on customer tier and quantity")
examples.typescript: rule.setDescription("Calculates product pricing based on customer tier and quantity");

exampleOutput.description: Calculates product pricing based on customer tier and quantity

methods.name: addNumberField
methods.description: Add a number input field to the rule's request schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

returns.description: The field instance with operator methods.

examples.python:
age = rule.add_number_field("age", "Customer's age", 0)
quantity = rule.add_number_field("quantity", "Order quantity", 1)
examples.typescript:
const age = rule.addNumberField("age", "Customer's age", 0);
const quantity = rule.addNumberField("quantity", "Order quantity", 1);

methods.name: addStringField
methods.description: Add a string input field to the rule's request schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

returns.description: The field instance with operator methods.

examples.python:
status = rule.add_string_field("status", "Account status", "active")
email = rule.add_string_field("email", "Customer email")
examples.typescript:
const status = rule.addStringField("status", "Account status", "active");
const email = rule.addStringField("email", "Customer email");

methods.name: addBooleanField
methods.description: Add a boolean input field to the rule's request schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

returns.description: The field instance with operator methods.

examples.typescript: const isPremium = rule.addBooleanField("is_premium", "Premium customer flag", false);

methods.name: addDateField
methods.description: Add a date input field to the rule's request schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

returns.description: The field instance with operator methods.

examples.python:
from datetime import datetime
created_at = rule.add_date_field("created_at", "Account creation date")

methods.name: addListField
methods.description: Add a list/array input field to the rule's request schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

returns.description: The field instance with operator methods.

examples.python:
tags = rule.add_list_field("tags", "Item tags", [])
roles = rule.add_list_field("roles", "User roles", ["user"])
examples.typescript:
const tags = rule.addListField("tags", "Item tags", []);
const roles = rule.addListField("roles", "User roles", ["user"]);

methods.name: addNumberResponse
methods.description: Add a number output field to the rule's response schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

methods.name: addStringResponse
methods.description: Add a string output field to the rule's response schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

methods.name: addBooleanResponse
methods.description: Add a boolean output field to the rule's response schema.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The field name/key.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the field.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default value for the field.

methods.name: when
methods.description: Start defining a new condition row. Chain with .then() to set the response values.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: Field conditions as keyword arguments (field=operator_result).

returns.description: A Condition instance for chaining with .then().

examples.python:
age = rule.add_number_field("age", "Customer age")
status = rule.add_string_field("status", "Account status")
rule.add_string_response("tier", "Customer tier")

# Define a condition
rule.when(
    age=age.greater_than(18),
    status=status.equals("active")
).then(
    tier="premium"
)

methods.name: any
methods.description: Start defining a condition with OR logic. Any matching condition triggers the response.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: Field conditions as keyword arguments (field=operator_result).

returns.description: A Condition instance with OR logic for chaining with .then().

examples.python:
# If ANY of these conditions match, apply the response
rule.any(
    age=age.greater_than(65),
    status=status.equals("vip")
).then(
    discount_percent=20
)

methods.name: findConditions
methods.description: Search for existing conditions that match specific criteria.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: Field conditions to search for as keyword arguments.

examples.python:
# Find all conditions where age > 18
age_field = rule.get_number_field("age")
matches = rule.find_conditions(
    age=age_field.greater_than(18)
)

# Modify the first match
if matches:
    matches[0].then(tier="gold")

methods.name: addTest
methods.description: Add a test case to the rule's test suite.

parameters.name: test
parameters.description: The test case to add.

returns.description: The rule instance for method chaining.

examples.python:
from rulebricks.forge import RuleTest

test = RuleTest()
test.set_name("Adult premium test")
test.expect(
    request={"age": 25, "status": "active"},
    response={"tier": "premium"}
)
test.is_critical(True)

rule.add_test(test)

methods.name: update
methods.description: Push local changes to the connected workspace without publishing.

examples.python:
# Requires workspace client
rule.set_workspace(client)

# Push changes to workspace (draft mode)
rule.update()

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publish a new version of the rule to the connected workspace.

examples.python:
# Requires workspace client
rule.set_workspace(client)

# Publish the rule (makes it live)
rule.publish()

methods.name: toDict
methods.description: Convert the rule to a dictionary/object representation.

methods.name: toJson
methods.description: Convert the rule to a JSON string.

returns.description: JSON string representation of the rule.

examples.python:
json_str = rule.to_json()
with open("rule.json", "w") as f:
    f.write(json_str)

methods.name: toTable
methods.description: Generate a formatted table view of all conditions for debugging.

methods.name: export
methods.description: Export the rule to a .rbx file that can be imported into Rulebricks.

parameters.name: directory
parameters.description: Directory to save the file. Defaults to current directory.

examples.python:
# Export to current directory
filename = rule.export()
print(f"Exported to {filename}")

# Export to specific directory
filename = rule.export("./rules")

methods.name: fromJson
methods.description: Create a Rule instance from JSON data.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: JSON string or object containing rule data.

returns.description: A new Rule instance populated with the data.

examples.python:
# From JSON string
rule = Rule.from_json('{"name": "My Rule", ...}')

# From dictionary
rule = Rule.from_json({"name": "My Rule", "conditions": []})

methods.name: fromWorkspace
methods.description: Load a rule from the connected workspace by ID.

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: The ID of the rule to load.

subResources.name: Condition
subResources.description: Represents a single condition row in a rule with request conditions and response values

methods.name: when
methods.description: Set or update the conditions for this condition row.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: Field conditions as keyword arguments.

returns.description: The condition instance for method chaining.

methods.name: then
methods.description: Set or update the response values for this condition.

parameters.name: responses
parameters.description: Response field values as keyword arguments.

returns.description: The parent Rule for new conditions, or this Condition for existing ones.

examples.python:
# For a new condition (returns Rule)
rule.when(age=age.greater_than(18)).then(
    approved=True,
    message="Welcome!"
)

# For editing existing (returns Condition)
condition = rule.get_condition(0)
condition.then(approved=False)

methods.name: setPriority
methods.description: Set the priority level for this condition. Higher priority conditions are evaluated first.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Priority level (higher = evaluated first).

returns.description: The condition instance for method chaining.

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Enable this condition so it will be evaluated.

returns.description: The condition instance for method chaining.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Disable this condition so it will be skipped during evaluation.

returns.description: The condition instance for method chaining.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Remove this condition from its parent rule.

subResources.name: Fields
subResources.description: Field types with operator methods for building conditions. Each field type has specific operators.

methods.name: NumberField.equals
methods.description: Check if the number equals a specific value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

returns.description: Tuple of [operator_name, arguments] for use in conditions.

examples.typescript:
const age = rule.addNumberField("age");
rule.when({ age: age.equals(18) });

methods.name: NumberField.greaterThan
methods.description: Check if the number is greater than a value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

methods.name: NumberField.between
methods.description: Check if the number is between two values (inclusive).

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The minimum value.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The maximum value.

methods.name: StringField.equals
methods.description: Check if the string equals a specific value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

examples.typescript:
const status = rule.addStringField("status");
rule.when({ status: status.equals("active") });

methods.name: StringField.contains
methods.description: Check if the string contains a substring.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The substring to search for.

methods.name: StringField.isIncludedIn
methods.description: Check if the string is one of the values in a list.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: List of allowed values.

methods.name: BooleanField.equals
methods.description: Check if the boolean equals true or false.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The boolean value to check.

examples.typescript:
const isPremium = rule.addBooleanField("is_premium");
rule.when({ is_premium: isPremium.equals(true) });

methods.name: DateField.isPast
methods.description: Check if the date is in the past.

examples.typescript:
const expiry = rule.addDateField("expiry_date");
rule.when({ expiry_date: expiry.is_past() });

methods.name: DateField.daysAgo
methods.description: Check if the date was exactly N days ago.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days ago.

exampleOutput: is less than N days ago

methods.name: ListField.contains
methods.description: Check if the list contains a specific value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to search for.

examples.typescript:
const tags = rule.addListField("tags");
rule.when({ tags: tags.contains("premium") });

methods.name: ListField.isEmpty
methods.description: Check if the list is empty.

subResources.name: DynamicValues
subResources.description: Reference and manage workspace dynamic values that can be used in rule conditions

methods.name: configure
methods.description: Configure DynamicValues with a workspace client to enable fetching values.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: A configured Rulebricks client.

examples.python:
from rulebricks import Rulebricks
from rulebricks.forge import DynamicValues

client = Rulebricks(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
DynamicValues.configure(client)

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get a reference to a dynamic value by name for use in conditions.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the dynamic value in your workspace.

returns.description: A DynamicValue reference that can be used in conditions.

examples.python:
# Get a dynamic value reference
max_discount = DynamicValues.get("max_discount")

# Use in conditions
rule.when(
    discount=discount.less_than(max_discount)
).then(
    approved=True
)

methods.name: set
methods.description: Create or update dynamic values in your workspace.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Dictionary of name-value pairs to set.

parameters.name: accessGroups
parameters.description: Optional list of access groups for the values.
